loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 27 years old, married and has three children. She owns a tailoring shop and has been in business for the past seven years. She also relies on her husband's income and was previously employed. She is hard-working, faithful and diligent. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has been exposed to seminars that have helped her manage her business.

Someday she hopes to be a designer and expand her shop. She requires a loan of 20,857 KES to buy fabric and school uniforms.

loans.use: to buy fabric and school uniforms.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than ten years now.

Marcelina is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds and vitamins for the pigs. With this, she will be able raise healthy pigs.

In the future, Marcelina dreams of making her business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Daeng

texts.en:
Daeng was one of the first of his generation of Malbri to grow up in a modern Mlabri world.  Before him, his father had known the hardships – and the independence – of a life lived mainly in the jungles.  Rampant deforestation and extensive agriculture reduced forested land to a fraction of its past area.  By the time Daeng was born in 1983, the Mlabri people had been reduced to indentured servitude in the slash & burn fields of other ethnic groups in Thailand.

Daeng grew up in the Ban Bunyuen village, and learned to read and write at the school there.  Basic education opened up many new avenues of knowledge for him, while village elders and his older relatives introduced him to the ways of the jungle.  Daeng thus straddles both generations; he is an example to the younger ones, and a help in guiding the older ones through the intricacies of modern life.

Daeng does not have the same fear of the outside world as the older generation does.  He can hold his own in a pinch and he knows where to go for help when he’s hard pressed.

Like many of his fellow weavers, Daeng weaves hammocks to provide a better life for his wife and their children- he’s a great dad!  He is savvy enough to make wise decisions in his purchases, yet retains a uniquely Mlabri penchant for helping others – something that weaving hammocks allows him to do. 

Daeng was one of the first to tell about Mlabri life in his lead role in the documentary film, The Importance of Being Mlabri.  He still functions as a liaison with outsiders, running interference for those with fewer skills in those areas.

Currently Daeng is saving up to buy a pickup truck to give him more independence in business.

loans.use: invest in raw materials so he can secure consistent weaving work and increase his income potential.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla, mujer trabajadora madre de dos hijos vive junto a su esposo en las Pilas Orientales un barrio aledaño al municipio de Ticuantepe, ellos son agicultores desde hace mas de 10 años, actualmente ella quiere hacer un plantillo de Yuca para eso requiere de Capital para poder comprar los insumos y la madera de yuca, gracias a este credito que se ha otorgado comprar los siguiente: Fertilizante, Urea, Madera de Yuca, Completo, etc. muy contenta doña Karla Agradece mucho el apoyo que se h abrindado durante estos años para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Karla is the hardworking mother of two children and lives with her husband in Pilas Orientales, a neighborhood in the city of Ticuantepe. They have been farming for more than 10 years. Now she wants to plant yuca, which requires capital to buy supplies and yuca wood.

She used her previous loan to buy fertilizer, urea, yuca wood, and more. Karla is pleased and thankful for the support she has received over the years that has helped her support her family.

loans.use: to undertake a soil treatment plan for her farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is aged sixty-seven. A farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and four children who are all schooling, he has been in farming for the past ten years, producing eggs and milk which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. He will sell the products and earn extra income that will help in improving his family's income and paying for his children's education. He aspires to be the main supplier of poultry products in his area in the next five years.

Pests and diseases are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel operates their tricycle business for passengers' transportation. She is 31 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is the driver of their tricycle. She has been in this business for five years. Maricel's children are all attending school. 

Her business is not the only source of income. They also engage in the farming business which their income usually goes for their children's education.

Maricel wants their passengers comfortable when arriving. She is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to pay for their tricycle sidecar. She hopes that her husband will have more passengers to transport and increase his daily earnings.

loans.use: to pay for their tricycle sidecar.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 35 years old, married and has three children. He used his previous loan to buy more newspapers from different editors. His business did well and he successfully repaid his loan. He is very hard working and humble. He has been in business for the past nine years. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has been able to expand his business.

Some day he hopes to buy a piece of land. He requests a loan of 84,442 KES to buy more newspapers.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a mother who owns and manages a small variety store in her community. She is now 52 years old and has two grown-up children. Despite the hardships of living, she has the strong determination to uplift their status of living and give her family a better life. 

In this regard, Susan aims to improve her variety store to generate a higher income. But due to insufficient capital, she is requesting an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy beverages, charcoal, rice, canned goods, seasonings and frozen foods for sale. Through her patience and strong determination she believes that someday, she will improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy beverages, charcoal, rice, canned goods, seasonings and frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a business lady who owns a salon. She used her previous loan to buy hair chemicals and braids. Her business did well and she repaid her loan. She has been in business for the past five years. She is very hard-working and diligent.

Some day she hopes to be a successful business lady. She needs a loan of 63,585 KES to buy hair chemicals, a dryer and a blow dryer.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals, a dryer and a blow dryer.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 31 years old, married and has two children. He has been in business for the past twelve years. He also sells animal feed. He is very hard-working and thanks to Faulu Kenya he has learned how to save his money for future purposes. 

He hopes to open up another shop and to have a wholesale shop for animal feed. He requires a loan of 63,585 KES to buy beans, rice, soda, wheat flour, maize flour, green grams and peas.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, soda, wheat flour, maize flour, green grams and peas.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Ubay, Bohol. For more than 20 years, she has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Narcisa is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, ropes, hooks, and lead weights. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch and give them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Narcisa hopes to expand their fishing business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, ropes, hooks, and lead weights

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 34-year-old businesswoman who owns a shop. She is married and has been blessed with three children. She also sells kerosene. She has been in business for five years. She is very hard-working and humble.

Rebecca hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. She requires a loan of KES 42,727 to buy sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, soda, and rice.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, soda, and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She has been in business for the past seven years. She also practices farming to earn a living. She describes her business as very busy. She has loyal customers. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money for future purposes. 

She hopes to be the main supplier of vegetables to schools and hotels in her area. She dreams of educating her children up to the university level. She needs a loan of 42,727.50 KES to buy carrots, potatoes, cabbages, and peas.

loans.use: to buy carrots, potatoes, cabbages, and peas

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 46-year-old business lady who sells used clothes. She has been in business for the past six years. She is also employed as a casual laborer and was previously involved in farming. She is very hard working, as she has to take care of her child. Through Faulu Kenya she has learned how to save her money for the future. She hopes to expand her business and to build rental houses. She requires a loan of 84,442.50 KES to buy four bales of used clothes.

loans.use: to buy four bales of used clothes

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman from Alicia, Bohol and a mother of two grown children. For more than ten years, she has operated a rice-milling business, together with her husband. This is the source of their income. 

Nenita is asking for a loan to buy additional materials for the rice-miller machine, like rubber rollers, and to pay for the repair of the machine. In the future, Nenita hopes of making their business grow and become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for the rice-miller machine, like rubber rollers, and to pay for the repair of the machine.

loans.name: Nona Grace

texts.en: Nona Grace is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Ubay, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari or variety store business for several years now. This is the source of her income. Nona Grace is requesting a loan to buy additional items to sell, such as canned goods, chips and snack foods, soda and beverages. With this, she will be able to cater to her customers' needs and sell more goods to them, which will augment her sales and income. Nona Grace dreams of expanding her business and making it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, chips and snack foods, soda and beverages

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: For the last several years, Pablita has earned a living by running a sari-sari or variety store where she sells various items to people in her town of Ubay, Bohol. Pablita is asking for a loan to buy additional items like canned goods, candies, sodas, beverages, soap and toiletries. This will allow her to increase her sales and her income, and make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Halle

texts.en:
Originally inspired by a desire to do international humanitarian relief work, Halle found her way to Uganda in 2006 to study conflict resolution. During her time there, she met many people who had been trained as tailors by international non-governmental organizations during the ongoing civil conflict. Unfortunately, many felt there were few job opportunities to apply their new skills to support their families.

To address this reality, Halle started One Mango Tree (http://www.onemangotree.com/), a small business that helps tailors in Uganda to find a market for their products in the United States. Using local organic cotton, One Mango Tree designs and produces womens’ clothing and accessories and provides additional training to its tailors to create new designs with their input. Seventeen women now work for One Mango Tree, and their jobs support their children’s ongoing education.

In 2012, she started to sell apparel directly to the public as well as wholesale to specialized retail shops. Her Kiva loan will be used to help Halle increase inventory, in terms of both variety (color, sizes and styles) and quantity. Since she is now selling wholesale, she wants to be ready to service larger orders.

loans.use: to buy more inventory (color, sizes and styles) for her small business supporting tailors in Uganda

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a caring, joyful, responsible, supportive, and determined person who has had a stand selling fruits and vegetables for several years now. An enterprising young woman who dreams of having her own mini-market to increase her income and improve her quality of life, Pamela has seen her business flourish since her previous loan.

Little by little, Pamela is increasing her product inventory and her sales. She is requesting a new loan from Yehu that she will use to purchase oranges, watermelons, tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, kale, etc.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, watermelons, tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, kale, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 49-year-old, married woman from Alicia, Bohol. She earns a living through her food-vending business. She sells home-cooked foods to the people in her place. 

Rebecca is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for food-vending, like meat, vegetables, and seasonings. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more food, thus, augmenting her sales and profit. Rebecca hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food-vending, like meat, vegetables, and seasonings.

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Together As One” group. They are small scale businessmen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, earn more profits, and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Foday, who is 35 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  He was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone but he now resides and works in Kenema. Foday has been a businessman for many years, selling used clothes. With the loan, Foday will buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current inventory.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha con su anterior credikiva compró pollo directamente en las granjas y y los vendió en su negocio , tambien compró víveres como arroz, aceite café, azucar; ella pudo ofrecer créitos a buenos clientes y hoy tiene mas compradores. En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidkdiva, mediante el cual comprará pollo en un mayor volumen, porque se acercan las navidades y el año nuevo y ella debe estar dispuesta a vender mas para aumentar sus ingresos. Está muy satisfecha con la venta de pollos, porque ha aumentado y ahora volvera a comprar este producto y víveres tambien; por eso agradece a los financiadores de Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues dice que si no fuera por estas organizaciones  ella estaría trabajando para los pagadiarios y ganando menos dinero.
texts.en: With her last Kiva loan, Martha bought chicken directly from farms and sold it at her business.  She also bought foodstuffs such as rice, oil, coffee, and sugar.  She was able to offer her good customers credit and she now has more buyers.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy chicken in greater volume because Christmas and the new year are approaching and she needs to be prepared to sell more to increase her profits.  She is very happy with her chicken sales because they have increased, as well as her grocery sales, and she thanks Kiva's lenders and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, as she tells us that if it were not for these organizations, she would be working for loan sharks and making less money.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and groceries

loans.name: We Are Here Group

texts.en:
In this photo, we see the members of the “We Are Here” loan group. Each member runs a small-scale business located in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are requesting for a loan for 800,000 Leones for each person in the the group. With the help of this money, they will each be able to improve on the quality and quantity of their businesses. 

Mariama leads the group. She is 29 years old and was born in Kenema, where she currently lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a trader and her children attend school. 

Mariama earns a living by selling ready-to-wear items. She has been doing this type of work for many years now and has done a good job of expanding her business and making a lot of improvements in her lifestyle. Though faced with the challenge of low sales, Mariama hopes to become an international businesswoman.  She is going to use her share of this loan to buy more clothes to to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa, 24 years old, lives with her husband and infant child. Several times, Raisa has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success, each request rejected because of low income and lack of business experience. The only current source of income for the family is the small monthly money transfer sent by Raisa’s mother, who works abroad to help the family.

Raisa’s loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of a business start-up, and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit Raisa will set up a small store to sell carpets, curtains and various household items. She will purchase items at wholesale prices and resell them in her store for a profit. It will be hard work for Raisa, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. Profits will be reinvested in trading to increase her stock and sales volume, and the family will be able to improve their living conditions. Raisa awaits your support.

loans.use: to set up a store.

loans.name: Pay It Group

texts.en:
Isata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isata was born in Kenema city, 29 years ago. She is married and has two children attending primary and secondary schools. Isata sells ready-to-wear clothing and has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her business.
 
From the daily profit that Isata earns from her business, she currently remains the care taker of her family. With the help of this loan, however, she is being empowered to take greater care of her family. (Also attached in the photo is a borrower who was unavailable for a group snapshot.)

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzo por superarse, lamentablemente Rosa no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser Secretaria, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una refrigeradora, la cual le servirá de mucho ya que podrá conservar mejor sus alimentos y bedias,de esta manera Rosa mejorara la salud e higiene de ella y su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 20 and lives in the city of Ica with her beloved parents and siblings, who are her reason for living. She is friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic, and devotes all her energy to being successful. Sadly Rosa wasn't able to study a profession, but she would have liked to have become a secretary. She likes to read in her free time and occasionally cook a delicious chicken and rice dish for her family. 

On her own initiative and with dedication, she labors as a fieldworker for an agricultural foundation in the city. She works every day for about 10 hours from early in the morning. She enjoys her works and feels she is doing fine because she works hard and treats others well. Rosa thanks the Kiva lenders whose support will help her buy a refrigerator to preserve her food and improve her family's health and hygiene. She will keep working hard to achieve her dream of owning her own house.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Miguel Ulder

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 53 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual s ecaracteriza por tener un clima calido y acogedor y sobre todo las personas que habitan la ciudad son personas de caracter muy alegre y carismático. Miguel comparte su vida con su pareja y fruto del amor que se tienen tiene un lino pequeño de 1 año de edad, por quien daria la vida con tal de verlo feliz y sore todo su pequeño es elmotor por el cual el lucha cada día, a pesar de las adversidades. 

Con mucho esfuerzo y responsabilidad Miguel trabaja como empleado en una empresa, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al dia y el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y honrado.

Miguel esta muy agradecido con el gran apoyo que le han brindado los prestatrios Kiva ya con esta gran ayuda el podra comprar materiales de construccion como maderas, calaminas, entre otros para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, ya que debido a que estamos en epoca de verano hay muchas lluvias en esta zon y es por ello que de esta manera evitrara que su vivienda se inunde, asi podra ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y seguira luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Tener una casa propia y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida".
texts.en:
Miguel is 53 years old, and lives in Pucallpa, a city known for having a warm and inviting climate. Above all, the people that live in the city very good-natured and charming. Miguel shares his life with his partner and out of this love they have a beautiful 1 year old son for whom he would give his life to see him happy. Above all, his son is the reason why he fights every day, in spite of his adversities. 

With much effort and responsibility, Miguel works as an employee at a company. He works around 9 hours per day and he believes it is going well because he is honorable and responsible. 

Miguel is very appreciative of the support that the Kiva lenders have offered him since with this help he can buy construction materials such as wood, corrugated iron, and others so as to be able to make some improvements to his home. Since it is the summer season, there is a lot of rain in this area and in this way he will be able to prevent his home from flooding and offer a better quality of life to his family and will continue to fight to see his greatest dream become a reality: to have his own home and offer a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy materials such as corrugated iron, wood, and other building supplies.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 25 years old. She lives in the village of Dingading with her two children. To earn a living, Arlene has been running a general store for two months. Her income is just enough for their daily meals. 

She wants to expand her business. In this regard, Arlene decided to take a loan to purchase canned goods, noodles, bread and condiments to sell. Arlene hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, bread and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Trust In  God Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone, 29 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple have five children who are attending primary school, secondary school and college.  

Kadiatu sells market food like onions and has been doing this business for many years now. Over the years, her onion business has grown from one level to another. Though sometimes sales are low, Kadiatu dreams of making more money in order to further expand her business. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy bags of onions to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy bags of onions to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Vidal Patricio

texts.es:
Vidal tiene 53 años de edad de estado civil casado  tiene dos hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Recinto PAMPAS GRANDE perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla AHORRANDO PARA EL FUTURO se encuentra ubicada el  recinto PAMPAS GRANDE, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Vidal se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño comprar un terreno para sehuir sembrando. En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Vidal, 53, is married and has two children.  He lives with his wife and the children in the precinct of Pampas Grande in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He belongs to Ahorrando para el Futuro Communal bank in Pampas Grande in Ventanas, which works in agriculture and livestock.

Vidal makes a living in agriculture growing corn and rice.  With the loan he'll be able to buy supplies: fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease.  He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The loan has helped him increase his income and his crops.

His dream is to buy a plot of land.  In his free time he likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide

loans.name: Maria Aquilina

texts.es:
Maria tiene 30 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene una hija, vive con los padres y con la hija en el Recinto PAMPAS GRANDE perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla AHORRANDO PARA EL FUTURO se encuentra ubicada el  recinto PAMPAS GRANDE, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño comprar un terreno. En los tiempos libres le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
María, 30, is single and has a daughter.  She lives with her parents and her daughter in the precinct of Pampas Grande in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She belongs to Ahorrando para el Futuro Communal Bank in Pampas Grande in Ventanas, which works in agriculture and livestock.

María makes a living in agriculture growing corn and rice.  With the loan she'll be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease.  She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The loan has helped her increase her income and her crops.

Her dream is to buy a plot of land.  In her free time she likes to clean the house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and tennis shoes to sell

loans.name: Eleutorio

texts.es:
Eleutorio es un hombre de 54 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Eleutorio no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Eleutorio trabaja en su pequeño cultivo de plátano, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el realiza labores de campo, se siente a gusto con su negocio y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y dedicación.
Eleutorio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de riego, fertilización y mantenimiento de su cultivo, de esta manera Eleutorio espera tener una buena cosecha y con ello una buena venta, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio y tener más hectáreas de terreno.
texts.en:
Eleutorio is a man of 54. He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his three children, whom he loves and who are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who devotes all his efforts to helping his family get ahead in life. 

Unfortunately, because of lack of financial resources, and the need to work, Eleutorio was not able to finish high school, but he would have very much liked to have done so. In his free time, he likes to play sports, and on some occasions cooks a very delicious "arroz con pollo" (Peruvian-style chicken with rice) to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with a great deal of effort and dedication, Eleutorio works on his small plantain crop. He works every day from an early hour of the morning, and can do so for around 10 hours. He does farm work and he feels happy with his business. He believes that it is going well because of his experience and dedication.

Eleutorio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided, he will be able to cover the expenses of irrigation, fertilizing and maintenance of his crop. In this way, Eleutorio hopes to have a good harvest, and with this, a good sale. Therefore he will continue working and doing his best to achieve his great dream of expanding his business and having more hectares of land.

loans.use: To cover the cost of irrigation, fertilizing and maintenance of his crop.

loans.name: Veronica Magaly

texts.es:
Veronica tiene 32 años de edad es divorsiada tiene un hijo vive con los padres y su pequeño hijo en Ventanas provincia de los Rios.

Ella se dedica a la costura confecciona ropa de hombre, mujer y niños, el credito le ayudado a crecer el negocio. El credito lo solicita para la comprar de telas, botones, sierres e hilos.

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas y vendes su mercaderia en la misma casa ya que los clientes van a la casa de ella.


El sueño de veronica es comprar un solar para construir una casa. en los tiempos libres le gusta descansar y pasar con la familia.
texts.en: Veronica, 32, is divorced and has one child.  She lives with her parents and small son in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She works sewing clothes for men, women and children.  The loan has helped her business grow.  She’s requesting the loan to buy fabric, buttons, zippers and thread.  She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas and sells her merchandise at home since her customers come to her house.  Veronica’s dream is to buy a lot to build a house on.  She likes to rest and spend time with her family in her free time.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, zippers and thread.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is 40 years old, married and lives in the Akhmeta district with his wife and child. Several times he has requested loans from local financial institutions to start a business, but without any success. His request was rejected each time because of his low income and lack of experience in business. Today his family lives on the small income he earns by working in a factory and his wife earns by working at the local hospital. 

Badri is requesting a loan from Credo to go into the business of selling clothing. He is making this request in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program is dedicated to helping poor people who live in rural areas get start-up loans to improve their life. This program is targeted at "high-risk borrowers” with low incomes who are trying to improve their lives. Badri and his wife will buy clothes for wholesale prices and resell them in their district for a profit. This will mean a lot of hard work for them, but they both believe that this business will be profitable and increase the family's income. He plans to reinvest his profits in the business to help it grow and prosper.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Aminata from Kulanda town Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between the ages of five and 17. Her children are currently attending school. In 2002, Aminata established her local retail business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to support her family. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says that the main challenges to her business are competition in the market and lack of enough capital to run her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more coconuts, bananas, beans, and palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Aminata plans to own a permanent business structure. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts, bananas, beans, and palm oil.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Haja from Kulanda town Bo. She is married with four children between the ages of eight and 17. Her children are currently attending school. She started this business to give her children quality education and improve her living.

Haja runs a fruit business; she sells bananas and oranges. She has been running this business for 10 years. She spends seven day a week and nine hours per day in her business. Her business is the only income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is poor road network in her operation area.

Haja has requested a loan in order to buy more fruit like bananas, oranges and apples. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve the life of her family and give her children a better education. In the future, she plans to become an international business woman. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more fruit like bananas, oranges and apples.

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is 57 years old. She is a widow and lives in the Khoni District with her grown son. Nazi works as a nurse locally and gets a small monthly income. Besides, the family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own two milk cows and a calf. Nazi milks the cows twice a day and produces cheese, which is sold at the local open market. In addition, Nazi has 13 bee-hives with bee colonies and sells the honey at a good price. 

Nazi has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start a trading business, but without any success. Her loan requests were always rejected because of lack of experience in the new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides credit to the rural poor who do not have access to it, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Nazi owns a building and plans to set up a grocery store there. With the loan she will purchase stock for the store. Selling grocery products will positively impact the family. This new business initiative will double their income and enable them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to set up a grocery store.

loans.name: Kurbonaly

texts.en:
Kurbonaly is married and has two children to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. His father died when he was little and his mother looked after him alone. When he became older, he began a business selling clothes. From the profits, he bought a car and five years ago he began his own driving business. Thanks to the good services he provides, he has managed to gain many customers. 

Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving as now his children are able to get a good education and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. 

He is asking for a loan to repair his car. In this way his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and hence to increase his income. This will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his car.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité es un grupo muy activo, y a pesar de tener algunos inconvenientes siempre supieron salir adelante, el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 5º, ya poseen ahorros y caja chica de todas las actividades que realizaron.
La Sra. Julia es una integrante mas del grupo, ella tiene ventas de Ropas de todas clases, modelos, marcas, colores y también por pedido y con el tiempo ella desea  que crezca su negocio y poner otras cosas mas con lo que ya tiene  con su esfuerzo y también gracias a la  Fundación Paraguaya. Ella siempre trata de  salir adelante. La Sra. Desea tener  su propio negocio con el correr de los años ya que trabaja ambulantemente.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de  ropas para poder seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.  En la foto del grupo aparecen 16 mujeres ya que el grupo tiene integrantes que las ayudan pero que no reciben crédito.
texts.en:
This committee is a very active group.  Despite a few challenges they have faced, they always are able to move forward.  The group is in its fifth loan cycle and the members have built up savings and petty cash for all of the activities they pursue.  

Sra. Julia is a member of this group.  She sells clothing of all types, styles, brands, and colors.  She also accepts orders.  Over time, she wants to grow her business and add other products.  She will be able to accomplish this through her own efforts and with the assistance from Fundación Paraguaya.  She always tries to get ahead, and wants to have her own business since she works in an ambulatory manner. 

She is asking for the credit to be able to invest in the purchase of clothes to be able to continue offering a wide variety to her clients.  In the photo there are 16 women since the group has members who help out but who do not receive loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Harold Alonso

texts.es: Harold Alonso de 43 años de edad se ha rebuscado la vida, trabajando de sol a sol en la calle, para llevar a casa el pan de cada día. No tuvo la facultad de estudiar por lo cual las oportunidades de empleo fueron nulas. Decidió aprender el oficio de la fabricación de útiles de aseo como escobas, trapeadores y cepillos. Después de aprenderlo con la ayuda de su familia montó la fábrica en su casa y desde allí comenzó a comercializarlas en las tiendas del barrio. Realizó un estudio de mercado a través de la observación en donde concluyó que el producto que mayor aceptación tuvo fueron los trapeadores, por lo cual se especializó en este artículo. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima debido a que desea aumentar la producción y empezarse a expandir por otros territorios del departamento de Antioquia, Colombia. Su mayor sueño es poder montar una gran empresa que le permita generar fuentes de empleo.
texts.en: Harold Alonso is 43 years old and he has always found ways to manage in life, working from dawn till dusk as a street vendor in order to provide his family with staple food. Having not had the chance to study, he consequently found no job opportunities and so he decided to learn how to create cleaning tools such as sweepers, floor mops and brushes. He then set up a tools factory in his house with the help of his family, and having studied the market by observing it, he came to the conclusion that floor mops were the mostly required products, thus deciding to specialize in this article. He is currently requesting a loan to buy raw materials in order to increase his production and to start expanding his activity to other areas of the department of Antioquia, Colombia. His biggest dream is to succeed in starting a big company that will give him the chance to create job opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase dowels, wicks, and handles for mops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de productos de belleza-cosméticos.

loans.name: Dayana

texts.en: Dayana is 27 years of age. She is from the simple village of Dingading where she generates income through her business. Dayana buys and sells vegetables. She usually earns about PHP 300 a day in these activities. At this time, Dayana is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy eggplants, cabbages, string beans and potatoes to sell. In the future, Dayana hopes to keep improving her business and earn funds to be used for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, cabbages, string beans and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Vivilyn

texts.en:
Vivilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing  in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. Vivilyn has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from buying & selling dried fish.

Vivilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothing to sell

loans.name: The Help Sisters Group

texts.en:
Musu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Musu was born in Kenema city 33 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively. Musu sells clothing and has been doing this business for many years now. 
With the help of this loan, Musu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Musu will use her share of the loan (1,500,000 SLL) to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Lenny

texts.es:
Lenny, de 35 años de edad, es una mujer amable,  trabajadora y emprendedora, es separada de su pareja y padre de su único hijo de 17 años, vive en compañía de su madre, sus dos hermanos, su hijo y su cuñada, habitando la casa que les dejó su padre como herencia material. 
Nuestra amiga Lenny tiene como principal actividad de negocio la venta de uno de los platillos típicos más representativo del Perú que es el “Cebiche” y lo alterna en sus ratos libres con la venta de prendas de vestir y calzados para damas, caballeros y niños en ciertas temporadas. Su negocio de cebicheria es un actividad familiar que tiene cerca de 11 años funcionando, ahí atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes con el apoyo de su madre, su cuñada, y sus hermanos desde que se inició en éste trabajo ha obtenido grandes logros ya que sus ventas siempre fueron favorables. Eventualmente vende prendas de vestir.
Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite estar siempre ocupada y generar los ingresos económicos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y los de su hijo al que quiere mucho, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene en su cebichería desea implementarlo con mejores muebles y otros accesorios que brinden comodidad a sus clientes.
Este es el crédito número 13 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1800), invertirá en la compra de 4 mesas con sus respectivas sillas, además comprará algunos ingredientes que necesita para continuar su negocio de venta de cebiches.
texts.en: Lenny, who is 35 years old, is a friendly, hardworking and enterprising woman.  She is separated from her partner, who is the father of her only child (a son of 17), and lives with her mother, her two brothers, her son and her sister-in-law in the house which was bequeathed to them by her father.  Our friend Lenny's main business activity is selling one of Peru's most traditional dishes: "Cebiche".  At different times of year, she also devotes some of her free time to selling women's, men's and children's clothing.  Her seafood restaurant is a family business which has been in existence for 11 years and she serves her customers there in a friendly way, helped by her mother, her sister-in-law, and her brothers.  Since she set up the business, she has achieved great success because her sales have always been positive.  From time to time she sells items of clothing.  She likes her work very much because it keeps her busy and enables her to generate the income she needs to cover her personal expenses and those of her son whom she loves very much.  So great has been the success she has achieved in her restaurant that she now wants to equip it with better furniture and other fittings to provide comfort for her customers.  This is her thirteenth loan from MFP and so she is grateful to all those who make it possible for her to continue to pursue her goals. Furthermore, she is once again very committed to make her repayments on time, as was the case for her other loans.  She is very happy to belong to her communal bank because all its members are very kind, friendly and caring.  She plans to spend the loan amount requested (S/. 1800) on 4 tables with matching chairs, as well as various ingredients which she needs to continue her seafood restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy 4 tables and matching chairs, as well as various ingredients which she needs to continue with her seafood restaurant business

loans.name: Fidela

texts.es: Fidela, de 58 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Víctor y sus hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace algunos años. Ella es una mujer muy exigente, gusta mucho de trabajar y que sus actividades sean de calidad, es natal del norte del país. Se casó  y desde ahí vino a radicar a Huancayo,  pero siempre estuvo trabajando aunque en menor proporción, pasaron los años y no se quedó atrás pues por un tiempo se dedicó a la venta de verduras en un puesto de mercado y también a la venta de agua de manzana, pero por motivos de salud. Pasaron 4 años desde entonces, ahora se dedica a la venta de celulares de toda calidad y precio, además de accesorios y servicio técnico. Comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio sobre todo por que siempre trata de conseguir la novedad y lo último en tecnologías. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “la florida” y con el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá el dinero en la compra de más celulares de toda calidad para su venta.
texts.en:
Fifty-eight year old Fidela is a hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband Víctor and her children, whom she cares for in the house she bought a few years ago.  She is a very tough woman; she likes to work and for her work to be of quality.

She hails from the north of the country.  She got married and came to live in Huancayo.  She has always worked, though to a lesser degree.  The years went by and she didn't get left behind.  For a while she worked selling vegetables at a market stand and also sold apple juice, but for health reasons.  

Four years have passed since then, and now she makes a living selling cell phones of all levels of quality and price, as well as accessories and technical service.  She says that her business is going very well, above all because she always tries to find novelties and the latest in technology.

She belongs to the solidarity group "la florida."  She feels empowered since she gets help to move her business forward.  For that, she promises to be punctual in her payments.  Furthermore, she likes to work with her group because they are responsible and supportive people.  Fidela will invest the money in the purchase of more cell phones of all levels of quality for selling.

loans.use: To buy more cell phones.

loans.name: Pedro Orlando

texts.es:
Pedro Orlando tiene 48 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene cinco hijos, vive con los hijos y la conyugue en el cantón de Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. 

Es integrante de la Ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Pedro Orlando trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz, plátanos y cacao. Hace sus compras y ventas cada quijnce días depende de la siembra. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, ranger y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a administrar bien su trabajo. El sueño es sembrar cacao y aumentar las siembras del maíz. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Pedro Orlando is 48 years old, married under common law, and has 5 children. He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.

Pedro Orlando belongs to the rural “Recinto San Ramon” communal bank, located in Nuevo San Ramon, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are 20 members in all who work in short-cycle agriculture (harvesting in 6 months). This is the 1st loan cycle the members have solicited from the Cooperative.

Pedro Orlando is a farmer who cultivates corn, rice, plantains, and cacao. He does his purchasing and his selling every 15 days, depending upon what he plants. 

Pedro Orlando requests this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, ranger, and manures.  He believes the loan will help him better administer his work. His dream is to plant cacao and additional corn.

In his free time Pedro Orlando likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, ranger, and manure for his crops.

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholas is 42 years old, married, and has three children. He used his previous loan to buy spare parts. He successfully repaid his loan. He works as a mechanic and has been a mechanic for the past twenty-two years. He also practices farming to earn a living. He is very hard-working and friendly.

He dreams of educating his children up to university level and also owning a garage. He requires a loan of 53,156 KES to buy a tool box, an overall uniform, and a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a tool box, an overall uniform, and a dairy cow

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Isatu, who lives in the town of Kulanda, Sierra Lone. She is a single mother with one child who is nine years old. Her child currently attends school, and she has gone into the business of selling dried fish to give herself a permanent source of income. She has been in this line of work for seven years and works every day from morning to night. Her business is the only source of income she has. Her main challenge comes during the rainy season, when it is difficult for her to secure supplies of fish to sell. 

Isatu is requesting this loan to buy more dried fish. She will use the extra income made possible by this loan to pay her child's school fees and expand her business. In the future, she plans to own a large stall where she can sell her fish. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more dry fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Greeting from Sierra Leone. This is 35-year-old Isatu who lives in Kandeh town. She is married and the mother of four children who range in age from 5 to 18 years old. All of her children currently attend school. She earns a living by selling slippers and clothes. She has been in this business for eight years, and works every day of the week from morning to night. Her business is the only source of income she has, and her main challenge is a lack of capital. Isatu has requested a loan to buy more rubber slippers to sell. The extra income made possible by this loan will allow her to increase her capital and improve her living standards. In the future, she plans to expand her business by opening a store. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Mamie from Kulanda town Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 10. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2006, Mamie established her food stand. She began her business because she needs to generate income to support her family. She works at the business 15 hours a day, seven day a week. She describes her main challenges to her business as her customer's low purchasing power, which means she has to keep her prices too low. 

Mamie requires a loan to buy more mayonnaise, eggs and cooking seasoning. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, Mamie plans to become an international businesswoman. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy more mayonnaise, eggs and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: United Brothers Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “United Brothers” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL apiece. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Amadu is the leader of this group. The 24-year-old is single with no children. For a number of years now, Amadu has been selling bowls. Though capital is low, Amadu has been able to make a living out of his bowl business. With the help of this loan, however, his capital will increase a bit, enabling him to buy a larger quantity of bowls to add to his current stock. In this way, he will consequently achieve his dream of erecting a structure to host his business.

loans.use: to buy more bowls to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 26-year-old single lady. Her father is employed in a firm and her mother works at a school. Her elder brother is a laborer. Bushra works at stitching and is an expert tailor. All the ladies in her neighborhood get their clothes stitched by her. She has been taking loans from Kashf from the last two years and has good repayment behavior. She wants to contribute to the studies of her sisters and that is why she has planned to expand her business. 

For this purpose, she took a loan of 35,000 PKR from Kashf for the third time to expand her tailoring center at her home. She will purchase four sewing machines and some raw materials including spools of threads and buttons. Her future plans include a tailoring center in her local main market and she is quite confident that her dream will come true soon.

loans.use: to purchase four sewing machines and raw materials including spools of threads and buttons for her business.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en: Kishwar, 4, is a married woman who has been running a business selling bangles for the past five years. She offers colorful bangles in various designs and sells them door-to-door. She makes enough to provide for her five children. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. At present, she is requesting a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase a variety of bangles in different colors. This will help her to fulfill the demands of her customers consistently. She dreams of providing a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of bangles in different colors.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small video game shop in her community for the last ten years. She offers various video games for every type of customer. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client base. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, Ishrat requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy more floppy disks and CDs of videos games by considering the choice of her customers and to buy bundles of audio/video cables. She will then be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy more floppy disks and CDs of videos games and to buy bundles of audio/video cables.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of two. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure and decided to work to initiate her own business to support her family for a better future. Four years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

She is currently in her 4th loan cycle and has borrowed 25,000 PKR from Kashf. Shaheen intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zippers, etc., to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Ms. Robina is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of six.  She has been running a general store for the last three years. She is eager to support her family members financially and to provide a better future for her children. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

In order to make her store fully stocked, she needs to purchase rice and flour. For this reason, she applied for a loan of Rs 35,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She wishes to spend a part of her income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase rice and flour

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 55-year-old widow. She is an energetic female who runs a business of milk sales.  She is efficiently doing her business to support the needs of her seven children. Ten years ago, she started her business after the death of her husband and since then has retained many regular customers. To increase sales, she needs to purchase one more cow with packs of animals feed so she applied a loan of 20,000 PKR. She has been in association with Kashf for four years and has improved her business gradually with the support of it. She expects a boost in her earnings and will use part of the increased income to provide quality education for her children so they can have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow with packs of animals feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43 years old and married with five children, ranging in age from 10 to 22. She runs a cookery business in her home in Kandeh town Bo. Two of her children are currently attending school.

She's been in this business for 15 years and sells food alongside her palm oil business. She also receives income from her elder son. She says that her business is going well, with new customers and increased profit.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more bags of rice, oil and cooking items to expand her cookery shop. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family's  living conditions. In the future, she would like to open a big restaurant. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, oil and cooking items to expand her cookery shop

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa sells saucepans and bowls in the town of Mpredwow near Cape Coast. Adwowa has no formal education.  She is single and has no children. Adwowa has been selling saucepans and bowls for three years now. She, alone, is responsible for covering her personal expenses. Adwowa will use her loan to buy a greater variety of saucepans and bowls for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her sales to increase her businesses capital base and buy even more saucepans and bowls.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of saucepans and bowls for sale.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is a 42-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Irshad is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 30000 PKR to buy stocks of rice, grains and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She has been in association with Kashf for five years. She wishes to spend part of her increased revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, grains and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Ulfat

texts.en: Ulfat is a 35-year-old energetic lady and a mother of six children. Her husband is a laborer and his income is not enough to bear the expenses of the family members. To overcome financial problems she decided to help out her husband by starting her own business raising cattle. She started her business with the support of Kashf foundation. She has cows and buffaloes with some small goats. She looks after them very well and makes a good amount of money to contribute in the family income. She has gradually improved her business by taking loans from Kashf foundation. She requested a loan of.35000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She expects an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend part of it on providing quality education for her children. Ulfat is much admired by the people of her community.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 30 years old and married with two children, ages 3 years and 10 years. She runs a food stand business in Kandeh town in Bo. Both her children are currently going to school. 

She's been in this business for 7 years and sells Maggi, flour, vegetable oil, tomato paste and cooking seasonings at her house. Her husband is a military officer and he usually helps her to support the home. She describes herself as a hard working woman and at present her business is doing well.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more flour, vegetable oil, tomato paste and cooking seasonings for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her start a savings account and live a healthy life. In the future, she would like to open a big food store. Nancy is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more flour, vegetable oil, tomato paste and cooking seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Leni

texts.es:
Leni, de 45 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, esta casada hace 29 años con Neptalí de 55 años quien es su inseparable esposo y su amigo incondicional, ella tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos ya son mayores y solo dos de ellos son menores, Divana de 15 y Diego de 16 años de edad, viven con ella en su casa propia que obtuvo como regalo matrimonial, ahí a diario les brinda lo mejor para que puedan ser personas de bien en el futuro.
El trabajo al que nuestra amiga Leni se dedica es la venta de comida. Al llegar la noche instala sus mesas y su cocina en la vereda para poner a la venta todos los platillos que ha preparado durante el día, hasta su puesto llegan muchas personas en busca de satisfacer su necesidad de alimentarse degustando potajes que tengan una exquisita sazón, al mismo tiempo aprovecha para vender bebidas refrescantes o en ocasiones gaseosas de todos los sabores. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace 4 años, aprendió que siempre tiene que estar de buen ánimo y demostrar una agradable sonrisa a sus clientes para que se sientan gustosos de haber acudido a ella y puedan regresar más adelante. Algunos fines de semana ofrece a la venta parrilladas durante desde la mañana hasta acercarse la noche.
Le va muy bien en lo que hace ya que tiene muchos clientes que le generan buenas ventas y ganancias diarias, espera continuar en su trabajo y más adelante establecer su propio restaurante para continuar brindándole a su clientela lo mejor y más variado en lo que se refiere a arte culinario. Por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1800), comprará todos los productos de primera necsidad que necesita para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Leni, who is 45 years old, is a charming and hard-working lady. She has been married for 29 years to 55-year-old Neptalí, from whom she is inseparable and who is her unconditional friend. She has four children, two of which are now adults and two of which are still minors: Divana, 15, and Diego, 16. These two live with her in the house that she received as a gift when she got married, hence giving them the best she can offer so that they can grow up to be good people. 

The work to which our friend Leni dedicates herself is the sale of food. At night she sets up her tables and her kitchen on the sidewalk to sell all of the dishes that she has prepared during the day. Many people come to her stand in search of a satisfying meal, consuming exquisitely seasoned stews. At the same time, she takes advantage of the opportunity to sell refreshing drinks and sometimes soft drinks of every flavor. She has been working at this job for 4 years now, and she has learned that she must always be in high spirits and put on a pleasant smile for her customers so that they feel good about coming to her and want to come back in the future. Some weekends she offers barbecue from morning until night.

She is very good in what she does, now that she has many customers with whom she is able to generate good daily earnings. She hopes to continue her work and in the future open her own restaurant to continue offering to her customers the best and most varied in what she refers to as culinary art. Therefore, she is thankful to those who would make this loan possible in order to continue her objectives. She is also very determined to once more make her payments on schedule as she has done with loans that she has received in the past. She is very happy to belong to a communal bank with such good, friendly and supportive members. With the amount for which she has asked (S/. 1800; $725), she will be able to buy all of the staples that are necessary for the preparation of her meals.

loans.use: to buy all of the staples that are necessary for the preparation of her meals.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Ms. Rehana is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has had a business of beauty for the past ten years. 

By this time, Rehana has become popular on her street for providing the best quality services to her customers. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed in a factory, but his income alone is not sufficient to bear the daily expenditures of his family members. 

Rehana contributes enough to the family’s income to support her family well.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy more beauty products, including makeup kits and skin care and hair treatment products, to meet the increasing demands of her customers. 

Rehana has been in association with Kashf for six years. She dreams of opening a training center to teach beauty skills to the girls of her community.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products, including makeup kits and skin care and hair treatment products, to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 40-year-old married man with six children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates drug shop and has been in service for nine years. He started the business after assessing the community need since the nearest health center is 15 kilometers away. 

High license fees and inadequate capital to meet high demand affect his business growth. His dream is to own a hospital fully equipped with modern equipment. He began this business to generate income to help him meet family demands. Benjamin is requesting this loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 30-year-old married man with 2 children ages 7 and 1 year who resides in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a carpentry workshop that he started five years ago where he makes chairs and beds. He has also been able to establish a produce business to supplement on his carpentry work. 

Julius dreams of constructing a permanent home for his family despite challenges of limited capital. He intends to use the loan to buy timber to make furniture.

loans.use: to buy timber to make furniture.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana, 41 and a resident of Kagadi, Uganda, is a married woman and a mother to three children aged 13, seven, and six. She owns a retail shop where she sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for four years, and she supplements her income with produce sales. Inadequate capital is a major challenge to her business. 

Bibiana intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap, and general merchandise to sell. She plans to build a good residential house and send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Yeanoh

texts.en:
Yeanoh, 42, is from Kandeh town bo, in the southern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 15 and 25 years. In 1990, Yeanoh established her retail business to create a permanent source of income. She works seven days a week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation problems in her area of operation and insufficient capital to run her business.

Yeanoh requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil and wood for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Yeanoh plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and wood for resale.

loans.name: Alena

texts.ru:
Алена – разведена, у нее есть взрослый сын. Она сама - из села Малая Кардашинка. Она занимается тепличным бизнесом уже 25 лет. Выращивает ранние и поздние огурцы, помидоры и редис на собственном участке в 25 соток. После того, как Алена развелась, она осталась сама, нужно было тянуть все на себе и поднимать сына. Алена не сдалась и справилась, смогла начать тепличное хозяйство.  
Кредит в размере 20 000 гривен нужен Алене для того, чтобы реконструировать теплицу,  а также купить семена и полиэтиленовую пленку для перетяжки теплиц в этом новом тепличном сезоне.
texts.en: Alena is divorced with a grown son. She is from the village of Kardashinka Malaya. She has been farming in greenhouses for 25 years. She grows early and late cucumbers, tomatoes, and radishes on her own 25-acre plot of land. After Alena was divorced, she remained single, and had to do everything and raise her son. Alena did not give up and was eventually able to start growing in greenhouses. Alena is asking for a loan of 20,000 hryvnia to reconstruct the greenhouses. She needs to buy seeds and plastic sheeting for covering the greenhouses in the growing season.

loans.use: buy seeds and plastic sheeting for covering greenhouses in the growing season.

loans.name: Atiqa

texts.en:
Ms. Atiqa is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business of tailoring for many years. She admitted the fact that the income earned by her husband is not enough alone to manage the household. 

In order to contribute to the family income, Atiqa initiated her own business of tailoring. She very well knows the techniques of sewing and sews clothes for half of the people of her community. 
 
Atiqa requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy a new sewing machine with reels of thread, buttons and zippers in different colors to meet the increasing demand without delay. 

Atiqa dreams of her children's bright and secure future. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine with reels of thread, buttons and zippers in different colors to meet the increasing demand without delay.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a 25-year-old hardworking woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession, and she joined the profession due to her desire to nurture the young people. With her salary savings, she has been able to pay school fees for her children.

Resty dreams of constructing a permanent house for her residence, despite challenges of delayed payments by the government and price fluctuation. She intends to use the loan to buy bricks, cement and sand for construction of her residential house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand for construction of her residential house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary used her previous loan to buy materials for making seats. Mary is 47 years old and hardworking. She has been making seats for eight years. She started by selling alcoholic beverages, then moved into produce sales until she acquired enough capital to venture into the seat-making business. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting her business. Her goals are to educate her children, build a permanent home, and expand her business to other markets. Mary intends to use the loan to buy chairs and beds to sell.

loans.use: to buy chairs and beds to sell.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan is 22-years-old and a proactive young man. He lives in the Armavir region with his parents and brother. Vardan studies at Yerevan State University in the Economics department. Vardan's parents are simply working people, and their income is only enough for covering the family's basic costs. It is very difficult for them to save money for Vardan's education. Vardan has requested this loan to pay for university tuition. The loan is very important for Vardan to complete his education and become a good economist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Kihika

texts.en:
Kihika used the previous loan to buy welding materials for making doors and windows. He is a 43-year-old, hard-working man, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been running a welding business for four years, having started as a carpenter. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the growth of his business, while his goals are to expand the business to new areas, buy land to grow crops, and educate his eight children. 

Kihika intends to use the loan for welding materials, for making doors and windows.

loans.use: to purchase welding materials for making doors and windows.

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: Doña Dora tiene ya 8 años de trabajar en su propio negocio de librería y kiosco bar, con el que saco adelante a sus hijos los cuales ya trabajan gracias a Dios, con este crédito piensa comprar cuadernos, lápices, papelería, borradores y productos básicos para el bar como gaseosas, golosinas entre otros, la señora Dora está muy agradecida porque con su negocio puede mantener su casa, les da para realizar obras sociales en conjunto con su esposo ambos muy trabajadores quienes también le venden comida a los maestros del centro escolar por el cual también utilizara el préstamo comprando carnes, granos básicos, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Dora has been running her own stationary store and snack bar for eight years.  With this business Dora provided for her children, who now work themselves, for which she is thankful to God.

With this loan she plans to buy notebooks, pencils, stationary and basic products for the snack bar like carbonated soft drinks and candy, among others.

Dora is very grateful because her business allows her to maintain her house and to perform social work with her husband.  Dora and her husband are both very hardworking.  They sell food to the teachers at the nearby school, so Dora will also use the loan to buy meat, basic grains, fruits and vegetables for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, stationary, erasers, carbonated soft drinks, candy, meat, basic grains, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Mariama from Kandeh Town Bo. She is married with ten children between the ages of 8 years and 25 years. Five of her children are attending school. 

Mariama runs a local foodstuff business. She sells palm oil, rice and gari (cassava flakes). She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business throughout the week; some of her children usually help her to run the business. Her business is the only source of income she has.
