She describes her problems as slow purchasing power of customers and a poor road network within her operation area.

Mariama has requested a loan in order to buy more local food like palm oil, rice and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay school fees for her children and improve her level of living. 

In the future, Mariama plans to become a supplier of local foodstuff. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more local food like palm oil, rice and gari.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance, 50, is a hardworking woman; she is married with four children, two of whom are in school. She runs a bar and lodge business that she started two years ago in the town of Kagadi, Uganda. She describes herself as hardworking and has a dream of buying a vehicle. But she says inadequate capital is hindering the growth of her business. 

Constance intends to use the loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer, and food to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 54-year-old, married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda, with seven children. His main business is growing maize and Irish potatoes for sale in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. He also rears cattle, which give milk for selling, for additional income. 

Like most farmers, George faces challenges of  prolonged drought and price fluctuations. His hope is to build a permanent house with proceeds from farming and livestock. 

George is requesting a loan to buy a cow for milk production.

loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 35-year-old hard-working man; he is married with three children, and he lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His main activity is farming: he grows maize for sale. Alex also operates a drug shop to earn additional income that helps him to buy supplies for his maize farm. Like most farmers, he faces challenges like price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes that have affected his business growth. 

Alex intends to use the loan to pay labor costs for weeding maize. His dream is to venture into modern farming methods.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for weeding maize.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 30-year-old, government employee who works as a community development officer. A mother to two children, she is married and lives in Kagadi Uganda. She has been in her profession for three years and was inspired into it by her desire to associate with the community. Her dream is to educate her children up to the University and to venture into farming. Catherine intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей с семьей живет в селе Водяное. Вместе с женой они уже 5 лет занимаются выращиванием овощей на собственном земельном участке, в основном это огурцы, помидоры и редис. Так как бизнес является основным источником дохода для Сергея, он постоянно вкладывает дополнительные средства в свое дело, все время стремясь развиваться. 
К КИВА Сергей обратился за суммой в 24 000 гривен с целью приобрести пленку, проволоку и рейку доделать теплицу, а также закупить удобрения, чтобы подготовиться к сезону. В этому году Сергей надеется переделать одну теплицу, а в следующем хочет заняться реконструкцией второй теплицы. Тогда можно будет оставлять их на зиму и думать об отоплении теплиц.
texts.en:
Sergei and his family live in the village of Vodyanoye. He and his wife have been farming vegetables (mainly cucumbers, tomatoes and radishes) on their own land for five years.  Since the business is Sergei's primary source of income, he always invests any extra money in the business and spends all of his time trying to develop it. 

Sergei has asked Kiva for a loan of 24,000 hryvnia in order to buy film, and wire racks to finish his greenhouse, and to buy fertilizer to prepare for the season. This year, Sergei hopes to rebuild one greenhouse, and next season he would like to rebuild the second greenhouse. Then, he can leave them be in the winter and only think about heating the greenhouses.

loans.use: to buy film, wire racks, and fertilizer for his greenhouses.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Ms. Shahida is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of milk sales for many years. She very well looks after her animals and sells their milk to the people of her community. She also sells small animals near an occasion of eid-ul-azha (a religious occasion) to get an extra amount of profit. 

Shahida is motivated to provide her children with good food, health and clothing, and is eager to support her family financially. She has taken several loans for the growth of her business.

Currently, Shahida requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase another cow to increase milk production capacity. She dreams of providing a quality life and bright future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase milk production capacity.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina, a 34-year-old married mother of a three-year-old child, lives with her husband, child, and in-laws in northern Albania. She and her husband have pigs and dairy cows and sell milk, dairy products, and baby animals to locals. Despite their hard work this past five years and the difficulties they have faced due to weather conditions, they enjoy their work. Profits have been good and Valentina and her family say they have been able to afford more than just their basic needs. 

Valentina is now looking for a loan to prepare the field for spring planting. She usually plants vegetables and other crops and sells them in addition to dairy products, and this gives her a little extra income. Valentina is requesting a loan of 100,000 AL. This will be her second loan; her previous one was paid in full.

loans.use: to prepare her field for spring planting.

loans.name: Kadida

texts.en:
Kadida is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to her work. She has been selling fish from her home for the last three years. Many customers prefer her because of the quality fish and, above all, the unequaled service and the high standards of hygiene. Kadida is a mother to four children and she is single, due to widowhood. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in more stocks of fish, cooking oil, and firewood. With these items, she is sure that she will have what she needs, so that she will continue to offer fish to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase of more stocks of fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Thabu

texts.en:
Thabu is married and has eight children.  She sells coconuts and brooms in the market as a street trader. 

Thabu is requesting a loan from Yehu, which she will use to buy more coconuts and brooms to sell. She works hard so she will be able to increase her sales and have a more stable place from which to sell. Her dream is to expand her business and have more products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts and brooms to sell.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap, aged 49, resides in a rural village of Samrong district, located in Cambodia’s Takeo province. She is married and the mother of five children, two of whom (a daughter and a son) are school-age children and still dependent on her. Pheap and her husband earn a living for the family by working as rice farmers. Having been in the business for about 29 years, she manages to earn about US $8.50 per day to meet her daily needs and is able to save about US $4 each day for the family's future needs.

This is Pheap’s first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. This hard-working mother will utilize the requested loan to pay the tuition fees for her daughter’s university education. This loan will enable her daughter to have an opportunity for higher education. Pheap’s biggest hope is to support and keep her daughter in university to pursue her bachelor's degree in finance and banking so she will have a good job after graduation and a bright future.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her daughter's university education

loans.name: Lyova

texts.ru:
Лёва вместе с женой уже 12 лет занимается выращиванием огурцов и помидор в теплице. У него есть арендованный участок земли в селе Водяное. До этого Лёва жил в Грузии, работал строителем. В Украину переехал с семьей, потому что здесь есть работа и, значит, возможность прокормить семью. Сейчас ему нравится заниматься сельским хозяйством, иногда он подрабатывает, делая ремонты. 
Лёва обратился за дополнительной финансовой помощью в размере 24 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести котёл и установить отопление в теплице, что значительно ускорит темпы созревания овощей в тепличных условиях. Со временем Лёва хотел бы построить новый дом для своей семьи
texts.en:
For the past twelve years, Lyova and his wife have been growing cucumbers and tomatoes in greenhouses. He has rented a plot of land in the village of Vodyanoye. Before that, Lyova lived in Georgia where he worked as a builder. He moved his family to Ukraine where he could work and feed his family. Now he likes to farm. He sometimes moonlights as a builder, doing renovations. 

Lyova has asked for financial assistance of 24,000 hryvnia to purchase and install heaters in the greenhouses, which will speed the growth of vegetables in the greenhouses. Over time, Lyova would like to build a new house for his family

loans.use: purchase and install heaters in his greenhouses.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 56-year-old woman with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a very hardworking woman who operates a bar and lodge with a pool table. She has been in business for six years, and with the proceeds she pays school fees for her children. Inadequate capital is a great hindrance to her business plans, although she still wants to own a modern hotel someday. The purpose of the loan is to buy soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has two children. She has received no formal education. Esi sells a local food known as gari, a dish made of cassava. Esi sells gari in Mpredwow, near Cape Coast, and has done so for the past 18 years. Her husband is a carpenter. Esi uses her income to support her husband and children. She will use the loan to purchase more cassava for the preparation of gari for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest in her business and increase her capital base.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava for the preparation of gari for sale.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 24-year-old man with one child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He operates a retail shop, which he started in 2010 to provide himself a daily income. He also earns additional income from agriculture and petrol sales. 

Godfrey intends to use the loan to buy more merchandise such as soap and salt to sell. His goals are to buy land for farming and own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is taking out a new loan to expand on her existing business. Thanks for the previous loan that helped to stock her business hence increasing sales. She is optimistic that this current loan will enable her to have an increased profit. Edith narrates that her aim is to own a retail shop in the near future. She is happy for the support Kiva lenders are granting her!

loans.use: to purchase more packets of tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik is a 49-year-old mother of three children. She lives in Kapan town with her husband and children. Shoghik works at a local clothing store. Her elder daughter, Nona, studies at Yerevan State University in the department of international relations. 

Together with her husband, Shoghik works hard to sustain her family. But unfortunately, their salary doesn't allow them to pay for Nona's education. So, Shoghik has requested this loan to pay for university tuition. 

The loan is very important for Shoghik, and for her daughter to complete her education, find a well-paid job and help her parents to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is still in his juice-selling business, which he says is doing very well. 

He has been able to make home improvements since he received his last loan, due to increased income. He is also happy that his children are doing well in school. 

Salim is a responsible man who promises to repay his loan as scheduled, so that he can take more loans to boost his business. With this new loan, he will be able to buy water, sugar and flavors to prepare enough juice.

loans.use: to buy water, sugar and flavors to prepare enough juice.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren lives in Kapan town with his wife and three children. He owns a little clothing store and together with his wife works hard in order to cover the family's basic costs. Suren's daughter Nara is 20 years old. She is a student in Yerevan State University. She specializes in the English language and wants to become a philologist.

Suren is doing his best to cover his family's needs, but unfortunately his salary doesn't allow him to pay for his daughter’s education, so Suren has applied for this loan to pay for the university tuition. The loan is very important for Suren and his family.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Sue

texts.en: Sue is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She makes and sells printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 4 years. She has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, brushes, and stencils. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services. She plans to use her profits to buy some new furniture.

loans.use: buy new material, fabric paint, brushes, and stencils

loans.name: Maria Maritza

texts.es:
María Maritza tiene 23 años es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

En la VCR 27 de Mayo sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esda zona. Se dedican a Labores Agrícolas u Pecuarias en su Mayoria.

María Maritza se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y Vende sus productos en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas,ranger, urea, insumos, fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar los abonos para la agricultura. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. El sueño es poder comprarse una casa. En los tiempos libres le gusta cuidar a los animales.
texts.en:
María Maritza, 23, is single and has no children; she lives with her mother in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  The members of the “27 de Mayo” (May 27th) communal bank work in agriculture and all live in the Recinto Cadial sector; they've practically been raised there.  They work in agriculture and animal husbandry for the most part.

María Maritza works in agriculture growing corn and rice.  She makes her purchases and her sales in Ventanas.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, Ranger [brand of herbicide], urea, supplies and fertilizer.  With support from the loan she will be able to buy manure for agriculture.  She faces challenges like infestations and diseases.  Her dream is to buy a house.  She likes caring for her animals in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, Ranger, urea, supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish in the market and smokes them for sale. Efua has been selling smoked fish for six years. She is married and has three dependents. She uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of their family. Efua will use her loan to buy fish to smoke, for resale. Efua will expand her business with the new profits.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and four children at Dabir near Elmina. Ekua sells beef, as she had done for some time now. Ekua uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe their children. Ekua wishes to increase sales, and a loan from Kiva will enable her to buy beef in large quantities. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beef in large quantities for her business.

loans.name: Rene Leodan

texts.es:
RENE LEODAN tiene 36 años de edad de eado civil unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con la pareja en casa de unos familiares en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se ddeican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

RENE LEODAN se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol gandúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras.

Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Ventanas cada 15 días dependiendo la siembra.

El sueño es tener una finca. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
René Leodan, 36, is in a civil union but has no children; he lives with his spouse in relatives’ house in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “27 de Mayo” (May 27th) communal bank work in agriculture and all live in the El Cadial Recinto; they’ve practically been raised there.  They work in agriculture and animal husbandry for the most part.

René Leodan works in agriculture growing corn and pigeon peas.  He’s requesting the loan to buy urea, insecticide, weed killing liquid and Ranger [brand of herbicide].  With help from the loan he will buy everything he needs for his crops.  He makes his purchases and sales every two weeks in Ventanas depending on the crop.  His dream is to own a farm and he likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticide, weed killer and Ranger.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is a petty trader. She sells soap and baby diapers at Dabir near Elmina. Salamatu is married and has two children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Salamatu will use her loan to buy boxes of soap and baby diapers to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap and  baby diapers to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish in the market and smokes them for resale. Aba has been selling smoked fish for a year now. She is married and has four dependents. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Aba will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale. Aba will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells banku (made from corn dough) and fish at Dabir in Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been selling banku and fish for the past 25 years. She is responsible for assisting her husband in paying the family's everyday bills. Her loan will be used to buy maize and fish to prepare her food to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize and fish to prepare her food to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa operates a chop bar (where African dishes are sold) at Dabir in Elmina. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa  has been in this business for 5 years now. She is responsible for assisting her husband in educating their children. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize,  cassava, and other ingredients used in preparing her dishes for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize, cassava, and other ingredients to prepare her dishes for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba produces kenkey (fermented maize dough) for sale at Dabire, near Elimina. She is a single parent with 2 children. Aba has been selling kenkey for the past three years. As a single parent, she is responsible for the general upkeep of her children, and so she uses her income for that.  

Aba will use her loan to buy goods, like maize, necessary to make kenkey. Whatever she has left she will save for the future and reinvest in her business. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize for the production of kenkey (fermented maize dough).

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie is a 42-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small cattle farm business. She has been in this business for one year. 

Debbie needs a loan to buy equipment for doing her business. She will use her profits to buy more cattle. Debbie joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fencing, a wheelbarrow, a bush knife, and shovels

loans.name: Melda

texts.en: Melda is 32 years old. She has a retail store based in her home where she earns about 2,000 PHP a week. Melda is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase grocery items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, and other ingredients to resell. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee and other ingredients to resell.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from rope-making and food vending businesses. Fidela is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell to her customers in her shop.

Fidela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
This is Beatrice, 38, a resident of Kisauni. Married, she lives with her husband and son and helps them manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Beatrice sells cakes. She also sells clothing. She sells her food door-to-door and from her home.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 KES loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil, food flavoring, etc. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Beatrice dreams of having a good future.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil, food flavoring, etc.

loans.name: Gina Pilar

texts.es:
GINA PILAR tiene 24 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y el conyugue en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se ddeican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

GINA PILAR se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,urea, insecticidasjol gandúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes que son necesarios para las siembras.

Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Ventanas cada 15 días dependiendo la siembra.

El sueño es sembrar 2 cuadras de cacao. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Gina Pilar is 24 and lives with her partner and two children in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

She is part of VRC 27 DE MAYO, whose members work in agriculture.  They all live in the Recinto el Cadial area.  They were basically all raised in this area.  They mainly do agricultural labor and raise livestock.

Gina Pilar grows corn and pigeon peas.  She is seeking a loan to buy urea and insecticides.

Buying and selling takes place in Ventanas every 15 days, depending on the harvest.


Gina Pilar's goal is to cultivate two acres of cacao.  In her spare time, she likes to read the Bible.

loans.use: to buy urea and insecticides.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa produces kenkey (fermented maize dough) to sell, at Dabire near Elimina. She is a single parent with two children. Adjoa has been selling kenkey for the past three years. As a single parent, she is responsible for the general upkeep of her children, so she uses her income for that purpose. She saves whatever she has left, for the future and to reinvest in her business. Her loan will be used to buy maize for the production of kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize for the production of kenkey (fermented maize dough) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies for his pineapple crops.

loans.name: Dúo Monte Horeb Group

texts.es:
DUO MONTE HOREB
Este grupo lo forma don Carlos, quien es casado, tiene 5 hijos y nos cuenta que esta solicitando este nuevo crédito para su tienda, incorporando productos que le hacen falta, además por la temporada navideña quiere vender frutas y verduras, aguas, y algunas golosinas, el espera que fape pueda apoyarlo y brindarles su ayuda porque ahora él lo está necesitando, además sus créditos anteriores le han traído mucha bendición para su familia ya que con eso el sostiene a sus 3 hijos que están estudiando y es mucho gasto lo que hace con ellos.
texts.en:
Duo Monte Horeb group
On group member, Carlos, is married with five children.  He tells us he is applying for this loan for his store, to add products that he is missing.  In addition, because it is Christmas, he wants to sell fruit and vegetables, water and some candies.  He hopes that FAPE can support him and provide help because he needs it now.  His previous loans have been a godsend for his family. With the loans he has been able to support the three of his children that are studying, which is very costly.

loans.use: to buy food products for selling in his store..

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is 38 years old. He is married and has five children. To generate income, he provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for more than six years and earns approximately 300 PHP daily. At this time, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase equipment to improve his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve his business

loans.name: Marylo

texts.en: Marylo aged 47 is in "ukay-ukay" business wherein her current activity needs greater capital to purchase a variety of products that would attract more customers. As a result, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy different shirts, blouses, blankets and shorts. She hopes to increase her sales this time.

loans.use: to buy different shirts, blouses, blankets and shorts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Aminadab

texts.en: Aminadab is a 44-year-old man from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for the school fees of his 5 children (Josiane, Niyogushimwa, Imanizabayo, Igiraneza, and Ingabire).

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Annonciiata

texts.en: Annonciiata is a 46-year-old woman from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  With the money she makes from selling and recharging lights, she will pay for the school fees of her 8 children (Olupa, Jacques, Zachee, Elizabeth, Rachel, Joyce, and Zipora).

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement is a 23-year-old man from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for the school fees of his child Pascaline.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is a 34-year-old man from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for him, his wife Josephine, and their 4 children.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Afrodis

texts.en: Afrodis is a 30-year-old man from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Marie Josee, and their 2 children.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Frederic

texts.en: Frederic is a 28-year-old man from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for the school fees of his 5 children (Joseline, Tumuhimbaze, Yarakoze, Izabisohozabyose, and Kurinde).

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is a 28-year-old man from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is a 32-year-old woman from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  With the money she makes from selling and recharging lights, she will improve her adobe brick home where she lives with her husband Flugence and her 4 children (Marie Jeanne, Tuyiringire, Chance, and Gisubizo).

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is a 51-year-old man from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will improve his adobe brick home where he lives with his wife Beltirde and his 2 children (Pacific and David).

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Theodosie

texts.en: Theodosie is a 42-year-old woman from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  With the money she makes from selling and recharging lights, she will pay for the school fees of her 4 children (Marie Grace, Marie Merci, Marie Diane, and Theodethe).

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Carlos Gabriel

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 32 años de edad y vive en la ciudad alegre de Chincha, caracterizada ademas por sus riquisimos paltillos tipicos y tambien por el desarrollo de la agriculura y tambien es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano. Carlos es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante, con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de odontologia, es por ello que ahora a logrado inicar su consultorio odontologico, en el cual trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable, honrado y sobre todo porque le gusta lo que hace.

Carlos esta muy agradecido co los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podra comprar herramientas y materiales quirurgicos para su pequeño consultorio, como bisturi, hilos, espatulas, espejos dentales, entre otros, de esta manera podra tener todos los utensilios necesarios para realizar su trabajo y sobre todo poder atender a sus clientes de mejor manera y poder atender a aquellos clientes de pocos recursos economicos; asi el seguira luchando cada dia para poder hacer realidd su mas grande sueño:" Tener la mejor clinica odontologia del pais".
texts.en:
Carlos is 32 years old and lives in the lively town of Chincha, which is known for its moreish, typical dishes, its agricultural development and for being the home of many of Peru's sporting greats.  Carlos has a lot of desire to move ahead in life and, with a lot of effort, he studied dentistry and has now successfully started his own dental practice.  He works there for around nine hours a day, treating up to 15 patients.  He believes he is moving forward because he is responsible, honest and, most of all, because he likes what he does.

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help provided, he is able to buy surgical tools and materials (such as scalpels, floss, spatulas and dental mirrors, among other things) for his small surgery.  He will now have all he needs to do his job and to treat his patients as best as possible.  He will be able to treat patients with very little financial resources and he can keep fighting to make his dream of having the best dental clinic in the country a reality.

loans.use: to buy surgical materials

loans.name: Betty Josefa

texts.es:
Betty Josefa tiene 24 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene tiene dos hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

Betty Josefa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol gandúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras.

Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Ventanas cada 15 días dependiendo la siembra.

El sueño es comprar terreno para los cultivos y mejorar las cosechas. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión, escuchar música.
texts.en:
Betty Josefa, 24, is in a civil union and has two children; she lives with her spouse and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “27 de Mayo” (May 27th) communal bank’s members work in agriculture.  They all live in the El Cadial Recinto sector, they were practically raised there.  They work in agriculture and animal husbandry for the most part.

Betty Josefa works in agriculture growing corn and pigeon peas.  She’s asking for the loan to buy urea, insecticide, weed killing liquid and Ranger [brand of herbicide].  With help from the loan she will be able to buy everything needed for her crops.  Her purchases and sales take place every two weeks in Ventanas according to the crop.  Her dream is to buy farmland and to improve her harvests.  In her free time she enjoys watching television and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticide, weed killer and Ranger.

loans.name: Josefa Daisy

texts.es:
JOSEFA DAISY tiene 31 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y el conyugue en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se ddeican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

JOSEFA DAISY se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol gandúl, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los sembríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas, el mal clima.

Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Ventanas cada 15 días dependiendo la siembra.

El sueño es comprar dos cudras de terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte en especial el basket booll.
texts.en:
Josefa Daisy, 31, is in a civil union and has two children; she lives with her spouse and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “27 de Mayo” (May 27th) communal bank’s members work in agriculture.  They all live in the El Cadial Recinto sector, they were practically raised there.  They work in agriculture and animal husbandry for the most part.

Josefa Daisy works in agriculture growing corn and pigeon peas and also raises pigs.  She’s asking for the loan to buy urea, insecticide, weed killing liquid and Ranger [brand of herbicide].  With help from the loan she will be able to buy everything needed for her crops.  The challenges she faces are infestations and bad weather.

Her purchases and sales take place every two weeks in Ventanas according to the crop.  Her dream is to buy two ‘cuadras’ [unit of land measurement] of farmland.  In her free time she enjoys playing sports, especially basketball.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticide, weed killer and Ranger.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa, 38, is married to a businessman, and the couple has a child who is attending primary school. A native from Bo in southern Sierra Leone, she and her family live in the eastern city of Kenema.

For the past five years Theresa has sold fabric. She is applying for a 4,000,000 SLL loan from SMT in order to buy more bolts of fabric to add to her current stock.

With the help of this loan, Theresa will be able to take better care of her child and overcome some of the many challenges she is currently facing.

loans.use: to buy more bolts of fabric.

loans.name: Iye

texts.en:
Iye is 37 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  Her husband is a businessman.  She is a small scale businesswoman in the city of Kenama in eastern Sierra Leone. Iye has been a businesswoman for 10 years. Her greatest achievement has been the expansion of her business from a small stall to a shop. Unlike those days when she used to sell in a stall under the hot sun, she is now able to sell her cloths with a roof over her head. 
 
Iye still faces a number of challenges especially large transportation costs and low business capital. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a wide variety of cloths to add to her current stock. In the future, she hopes to further expand her business and continue providing the best education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cloths to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 58 años, es una mujer muy jovial, alegre y muy trabajadora, está casada hace 15 años con Carlos de 61 años con quien tuvo un solo hijo a quien ama con toda su vida a pesar de ser ya mayor y haber formado su propia familia, vive en la casa propia que construyó su esposo, ahí comparten juntos su día a día disfrutando el uno al otro de su compañía y del sueños de envejecer viviendo dignamente. El trabajo de Lidia, consiste en la venta de cosméticos, vende todo tipo de artículos mediante el sistema de venta por catálogo o exhibición, tiene una vitrina en su casa en donde llegan sus clientes en busca de perfumes, talcos, cremas, desodorantes o algún accesorio de utilidad. Lleva en ésta actividad desde hace 17 años, trabaja sola y gana muy bien. Alterna esta actividad eventualmente con la venta de productos de limpieza como detergentes, lejías, cremas dentales y otros. Por lo pronto, continúa trabajando en la venta de cosméticos y le gusta lo que hace, sus ganancias están aseguradas con los clientes que ya ha logrado consolidar con el paso de los años, está muy contenta por la independencia que tiene y porque puede generar ella misma sus propios ingresos para solventar los gastos necesarios en su hogar, espera seguir trabajando y expandir su negocio para continuar progresando ya que desea brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de acceder a una educación de calidad a través de una carrera profesional. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito financiero que le brinda la seguridad para continuar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea dejar una imagen negativa en los miembros de su grupo que se caracterizan por la puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará principalmente cosméticos como talcos, cremas, perfumes y otros accesorios.
texts.en:
Lidia is a very cheerful and hard-working 58-year old woman. She's been married to Carlos (61 years old) for 15 years now and together have a son, whom she loves with all her heart despite being already grown up and with his own family. They live in their own house, built by her husband, where they share every day enjoying each other company and their dream of getting older with dignity. 

Lidia works selling cosmetics. She sells all kind of products through a catalog system and has a display cabinet at home for her clients to find perfumes, talcum powder, creams, deodorants and other useful accessories. She has been at this job for 17 years, works alone and has very good earnings. Occasionally, she combines this activity with the sale of cleaning products, such as detergent, bleach, toothpaste and others. 

For the time being, she continues to work selling cosmetics and enjoy what she does. Her earnings are guaranteed with the clients she has been able to maintain over the years, and she's very happy with the independence she has and for being able to earn income herself to cover the necessary expenses at her home. She plans to continue working and to expand her business, so that she'll be able to provide her children with quality education and professional studies. 

This is her second loan with MFP. She feels grateful to those who give her the opportunity to access this loan, which gives her the support she needs to continue working. Once again, she commits to complying with the scheduled repayments in a timely manner, as she doesn't want to show a negative image of the group members, who have always shown punctuality and responsibility in their payments. She will use the 1,200 soles requested to buy cosmetic products, such as talcum powder, creams, perfumes and other accessories.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products, such as talcum powder, creams, perfumes and other accessories.

loans.name: Eyvar

texts.es:
El Sr. Eyvar tiene 23 años, se considera una persona muy carismática, honesta, sencilla y que le gusta trabajar mucho. Eyvar vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Tulcán que se encuentra en la Provincia del Carchi. Eyvar como una forma de salir adelante y buscar un bienestar para su familia emprendió el  trabajo de Albañilería hace 5 años atrás, le va muy bien gracias a su carisma y un trabajo honesto y responsable
 Actualmente Eyvar solicitó un crédito a FODEMI con el cual invertirá en la compra de compresor y una concretara necesarios para su trabajo como albañil, como actualmente su trabajo está siendo muy cotizado es necesario tener estas herramientas para darle a sus clientes un buen servicio.
Eyvar sueña en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres, brindándoles todo lo que ellos necesiten, como una forma de agradecimiento por todo lo que sus padres le dieron a Eyvar y agradece a DIOS por darle la fuerza y la motivación para salir a delante.
texts.en:
Eyvar, 23, considers himself to be a very charismatic, honest, unassuming person who likes to work very much.  He lives with his parents in the city of Tulcán which is located in El Carchi Province.  In order to get ahead and seek his family’s well-being, Eyvar started to work in construction five years ago.  He does very well thanks to his charisma and his honest, responsible work.

He’s currently asking FODEMI for a loan to buy a compressor and a cement mixer needed for his construction work.  His work is currently highly sought-after and he needs to have these tools to provide good customer service.

Eyvar dreams with improving his parents’ quality of life providing them with everything they need as a way of thanking them for everything they gave him; he thanks God for giving him the strength and motivation to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and a cement mixer.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is divorced, has two children and lives in Elmina. As a single parent, she is responsible for taking care of her children, and so she works hard to do so.

For the past three years Aba has sold corn and cassava dough and the kenkey (fermented maize dough) that she makes. She is applying for a 500 GHS loan from CRAN to buy maize for her corn dough and also to make her kenkey to sell in Dabire near Elmina.

Whatever she has left, Aba will save for the future and reinvest in the business. She hopes to use new profits to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy maize to make her cone dough and kenkey.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania, de 36 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con German de 38 años con quien tiene dos hijos de 16 Gabriela y Angélica de 4 años de edad, ella trabaja mucho todos los días para poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, vive durante muchos años en su casa propia.
El trabajo de Tania consiste en la venta de productos cosméticos como talcos, perfumes y accesorios y otras mercaderías como ropa y zapatos de acuerdo a la temporada en que se encuentre, a diario sale en busca de sus clientes quienes en su mayoría son amigos, vecinos y familiares, lleva realizando este trabajo por 14 años y siempre lo ha hecho sola. También tiene una vitrina exhibidora en su casa en donde coloca los productos que tiene en stock para vender a los clientes que llegan a su vivienda. 
Con el tiempo aprendió que para tener éxito en este tipo de trabajo tiene que salir en busca de los clientes usando técnicas de convencimiento para poder vender lo suficiente y obtener buenas ganancias. Espera seguir trabajando y tener mucho éxito en adelante, ahora tiene muchas ventas y eso significa que tiene mayores ingresos económicos que le ayudan a mejorar las condiciones de vida que quiere ofrecer a su familia. por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000) comprará mercadería conformada por prenda de vestir y algunos cosméticos que necesita para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Tania, 36, is a good, kind, very hardworking woman.  She lives with German, 38, with whom she has two children: Gabriela, 16, and Angélica, 4.  She works very much every day to provide her children with a better quality of life.  She’s lived in her own house for many years.

Tania’s work consists in selling cosmetics like talc, perfume and accessories and other merchandise like clothes and shoes according to the season she’s in.  She heads out daily seeking customers who for the most part are her friends, neighbors and family members.  She’s been doing this work for 14 years and has always done it alone.  She also has a display case at home where she places the products she has in stock to sell to customers who come by her house.

In time she learned that in order to be successful in this type of work she needs to go out looking for customers using persuasion techniques to sell enough to earn good profits.  She hopes to continue to work and to have much success in future.  Her sales are very good now and this means her income is better and that helps her improve the living conditions she’s able to offer her family.  

Because of this, she is grateful for the opportunity and for the trust placed in her to receive this loan.  On the other hand, she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She enjoys being part of her communal bank because she’s noted that all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.  She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy merchandise comprising clothes and some cosmetics she needs to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married to a farmer and has three children. They live together in Elmina.

For the past two years Abena has cooked and sold meals of rice topped with a meat and vegetable sauce. She uses her income to help pay for the children’s school fees.

Abena is applying for a 400 GHS loan from CRAN to buy bags of rice, meat and other ingredients she needs to prepare the food she sells. Her ambition is to establish a restaurant with her extra profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, meat and other ingredients for the meals she sells.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Pictured here is Mariama, a petty businesswoman in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. A native of Kenema, the 48-year-old is a widow with eight children, seven of whom are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. 

Mariama has been a businesswoman for many years now. One of her greatest successes is educating her children. And her greatest challenge is transportation. 

Hiring a vehicle to transport the timber to the market remains a big challenge for Mariama. But she is very optimistic that this is a challenge she will overcome, as success is her dream. 

Mariama has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Leones in order to buy more timber to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy more timber to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 45 años, es una mujer buena y muy responsable, es soltera, tiene un niño de 3 años de edad a quien cría brindándole mucho amor y protección y desea brindarle una buena calidad de vida, ella vive en su casa propia a lado de sus dos hermanas a quienes acoge en su hogar con mucho cariño. El trabajo de Mary consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, tiene un taller en su casa y lleva realizando este trabajo hace 16 años, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió trabajando desde joven como empleada de una señora que se dedicaba a este oficio, poco a poco y con mucha paciencia fue conociendo sobre técnicas de costura y decidió independizarse para generar sus propios ingresos poniendo en práctica todo lo que le enseñó su empleadora de entonces. Durante el tiempo que está dedicada a esta actividad siempre ha buscado la mejor forma para realizar su trabajo ya que muchas veces la presión de sus clientes la ha llevado a sentir que no iba a poder cumplir eficientemente su labor, sin embargo le hizo frente a las adversidades y actualmente tiene planes de expansión para su negocio, pero sabe que el camino para lograrlo es largo y por el momento desea mantenerlo como una meta a largo plazo, ahora se preparará para empezar a confeccionar sus propios diseños y venderlos ya que tiene pedidos de sus clientes. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí. Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1200), implementará su taller de costura comprando telas, agujas, hilos y otros accesorios que necesita para continuar con su trabajo de confecciones.
texts.en:
Mary, 45, is a good, very responsible woman.  She’s single and has a 3-year-old little boy she cares for with much love and protection; she wants to provide him with a good quality of life.  She lives in her own house alongside her two sisters who she welcomes in her home affectionately.

Mary’s work consists in sewing clothes.  She has a home-based workshop and has been doing this work for 16 years.  Everything she knows she learned working from a very young age as an employee of a woman who did this kind of work.  Gradually and with much patience she learned sewing techniques and then decided to become independent to generate her own income by putting into practice everything her former employer had taught her.

During the time she’s been in this activity, she’s always sought the best way to do her work because often pressure from her customers has made her feel like she’d be unable to do her work efficiently.  However, she faced these adversities and currently plans to expand the business but knows that the road to attain this is long and for the moment wants to keep it as a long-term goal.  For now, she’s getting ready to start manufacturing her own designs to sell; she already has pending customer orders.

This is MFP loan #4 and she’s grateful to those who make the loan possible so she can continue towards her objectives.  On the other hand, she’s committed once again to punctually make her installment payments like she’s done with previous loans she got.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very good, kind and mutually supportive.  She will use the requested 1,200 soles to increase her workshop buying fabric, needles, thread and other accessories she needs to continue with her clothes making work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bee hives.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has been an entrepreneur since she moved to the United States nine years ago. Patricia is originally from Peru.  

For the past six years now, Patricia has been operating a successful catering and events-planning business. She began her business informally and over the last year the business has become incorporated. Patricia prepares and sells Ecuadorian food. She also caters for parties, events, and small gatherings, for both adults and children. She has been very successful and through the years has been able to garner support and clientele through client referrals. 

Patricia needs a loan to purchase catering utensils, equipment, and inventory. Patricia continues to operate her business from home. She lives with her two daughters and husband who at times assist her in her business when she is very busy. Patricia’s business provides the income for the family to send her daughters to college. Support Patricia in her efforts to grow her business and to continue to provide the economic support to her family so that they continue to prosper in the United States!

loans.use: To purchase catering equipment and inventory.

loans.name: Roselita

texts.en:
Support Roselita’s family run Paris Beauty Store!  

Roselita is from France. She met her husband in Paris on one of his frequent visits to the country. Roselita loves the French culture and language. When Roselita and her husband decided to settle in Florida, they were determined to take a piece of France home with them.  

In 2011 they opened Paris Beauty Store. Roselita loves running a business where she and her husband work together and share in the passion for what they do. Roselita has a son who is growing up in the business. The business economically supports her son’s educational development.  

“Our greatest success has been in establishing a network of loyal distributors who support to sell our products in the United States, the Caribbean and Canada. Our greatest challenge has been finding the capital to support our business. I am new to this country and had to learn quickly how to build my personal credit and credit opportunities in this country.”  

Help Roselita continue to purchase French products wholesale that her customers are expecting from her. With your help Roselita’s business can grow in 2013!

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire a new employee to help increase the number of contracts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase updated accounting software.

loans.name: Dianelys

texts.en:
Dianelys always had a dream of starting her own business.  Originally from Cuba, Dianelys came to the United States five years ago and did just that.  Her business has been open for just over a year.  

Dianelys' business distributes medical supplies. Her clients are surgeons who hire her services for distribution of medical supplies mainly for the hospitals of Miami. Dianelys carries all the disposable materials needed for surgery rooms. She has been able to compete with the large distributors because she has personalized service and fast delivery. Dianelys is able to get really good prices from Medline, where she buys most of the items. She also hand delivers the product.  She has now an immediate need to set up a website.  Dianelys is interested in expanding into the Broward region of Florida.  To do this, she needs marketing help.  

Assist Dianelys in her dream of expanding her business.  “The most important aspect of being business owners is providing the best possible service.  Clients come to me because I am reliable and  I take the time to listen to their needs.  It is not just about providing the highest quality product (which I do), but it is also about building relationships with my clients that has allowed my business to succeed.”

loans.use: To set up her own website.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bee hives.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El Sr. Ramiro  tiene 22 tiene dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 6 años, el se dedica a la venta de variedad de edredones, sabanas y frazadas en su tienda que se encuentra en la zona las Delicias de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Ramiro  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de edredones por mayor ya que  esta época tiene mucha demanda y el desea surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que le hicieron algunos pedidos y no contaba con el capital necesario para de sus productos, El Sr. Ramiro  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y la alta demanda por la época y va a utilizar los beneficios en aumentar su mercadería y por ende sus ventas.
texts.en: Ramiro is 22 years old. He has two children who are 4 and 6 years old. He makes a living selling a variety of bedspreads, sheets and blankets from his store which is located in the Delicias neighborhood in the city of Cochabamba. This is the first loan he will be taking out through the communal bank. Ramiro will use the loan to buy a variety of bedspreads at wholesale price, as it is currently the season in which there is high demand and he wants to stock his business. The reason he has requested a loan is because he has received various orders and he does not have the necessary funds to be able to buy the requested items. The challenges that Ramiro faces in his business are competition and meeting the increased seasonal demand. He will use the loan to increase his merchandise, and therefore his sales as well.

loans.use: to buy comforters at wholesale price for resale.

loans.name: Esperanza Para Vivir 1 Group

texts.en:
Mayra is the coordinator of her group Esperanza Para Vivir 1 (Hope For Life). The group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, and known for its tobacco and beef production. The group members are dedicated to selling clothes, food, shoes and jewelry.

Mayra is a single woman without children who lives in a simple house with her parents’ family. Besides helping her parents financially, she is dedicated to working hard to save money and grow her business.

Mayra has been running her business for around four and a half years. She started taking loans with Esperanza International because she needed capital to increase her sales and inventory. She is excited that her group is taking a fifth loan, this one for 145,000 DOP, from which she will receive a portion to buy various products like cosmetics, clothes and shoes.

Mayra will reinvest her profits in her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy various products like cosmetics, clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Cyprian

texts.en:
Cyprian is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He has been a farmer for over ten years. In an attempt to increase his income, Cyprian now desires to invest in beekeeping/farming. Cyprian is a married father of seven children; only the last two are still in school.

Cyprian was introduced to Milango Financial Services by his friends and is applying for a loan of KES 52,250 (Kenya shillings) to purchase beehives. He intends to save the additional income for future projects, especially to increase the number of animals on his farm. He also believes there will be increased income from this new investment. Cyprian's farming business has previously faced the challenge of lack of adequate rainfall, which is why he decided to invest in this new business.

loans.use: To purchase beehives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beehives.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
en la calidad ciudad de Ica, vive Jose quien tiene 36 años de edad, el cual vive al lado de sus padres a quienes apoya con el fruto de su trabajo, jose es una persona muy carismatica, sobre todo porque le gusta conversar y tener un buen animo. con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera tecnica de computacion e informatica, y luwego de mucho buscar enmpleo logro ingresar a una empresa como empleado, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al dia y el cree que esta saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo porque es honrado y atiende bien a los clientes. 

jose esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva porque gracias al apoyo brindado el podra comprar una moto, con la cual podra movilizarse ya que actualmente gasta mucho dinero en movilizarse y de esta manera podra ahorrar dinero y cumplir con aun con mas responsabilidad en su trabajo, asi el seguira esforzandose por hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Tener su casa propia".
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old and lives in the city of Ica, known for its warm climate.  He lives with his parents, who he supports with his earnings from his job.

Jose is very charismatic, particularly because he likes to talk and he has a great attitude.

With a lot of effort, Jose obtained a technical degree in computer science.  After an intensive job search, he was hired by a company, for which he now works ten hours a day.  He feels that he is getting ahead in his work because he is responsible, and above all honest, and he looks after his clients well.

Jose is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to buy a motorbike, with which he will be able to commute and get around.  He currently spends a lot of money on such travel, so with a motorbike he will be able to save money and even better fulfill his work responsibilities.  In this way he will continue working hard to make his greatest dream a reality:  “to have his own home.”

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: La Sra. Rita tiene 31 años, tiene cuatro hijos, se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo,  es promotora,  ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Rita va a usar este préstamo  para comprar zapatos que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio ya que esta época su demanda se incrementa ya que tiene muchos pedidos que entregar,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, La Sra. Rita enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Rita is 31 years old and has four children. She makes a living selling shoes from catalogs. She is a sales representative, and sells by walking to public and private institutions, visiting different neighborhoods to offer her products. This is the first loan she will take out through the communal bank. Rita will use the loan to buy shoes that are currently on sale to have in stock for her business. During this season there is increased demand and she already has a lot of orders to fulfill. Her reason for requesting a loan is to be able to have a variety of products to satisfy her customers. The challenge Rita faces in her business is being able to provide service to her customers in an efficient way. She will use the increased profit she receives as a result from her loan to better the quality of life for her family, as this is the only source of income she has to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes at wholesale price.

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es: El Sr. Toribio tiene 51 años, tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de 2 años,  El Sr. Toribio se dedica  a la fabricación y venta de joyas enchapadas en oro tiene su joyería que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Toribio va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de  materia prima para la fabricación de  joyas y así ofrecer variedad de joyas a sus clientes  y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Toribio es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Toribio, age 51, has a two year old son.  Toribio makes and sells gold-plated jewelry.  His jewelry shop is in the Alto Lima area of the city of El Alto.

This loan is his second cycle with the institution.  Toribio will use this loan to buy raw material to make jewelry.  This way he will offer his customers a variety of jewelry and provide them with better service.  He will also increase his income.  

His reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving in his business.  Toribio is a very hard-working person, and he is happy about the opportunity offered to him.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make jewelry.

loans.name: Esperanza Para Vivir 2 Group

texts.en:
Aura lives in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. The economy depends on agricultural industries. Aura and her group of five members are taking loans for their businesses. This group is named Esperanza Para Vivir (Hope to Live) 2.

Aura requires a loan to purchase clothes, jewelry, underwear and accessories. She runs a small business in her neighborhood selling miscellaneous products. This is her second loan with Esperanza International. She will take a step toward improving her business by investing this loan to increase her sales. She has had her business for over one year. She says that her favorite things are to do business and work. Aura and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: To buy clothes, jewelry, cosmetics and other miscellaneous products

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a resident of the Changamwe area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married business lady.  Mejumaa owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for two years. In this shop, she sells mainly coconuts. Mejumaa has one child. 

She learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. The main challenge is seasonality/scarcity of the coconuts.

Mejumaa is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase coconuts for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts to sell

loans.name: Al-Rhma Group

texts.en:
Al-Rhma Group is located at Hodeidah,Yemen. The group is made up of four ladies. 

Haloom, 46, is a mother of eight children. She works very hard in selling various products, such as cosmetic materials, incense and clothing, by going from door to door. 

The credit goes for the first loan Haloom acquired, which got her job started. Due to the little profit she is making out of it, she is forced to apply for another loan to keep her job running and to cover the demands of the season.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products like cosmetic materials, incense and clothing to continue improving her business.

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 1 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the group Fe y Accion 1 (Faith and Action). This group, like many others, runs its businesses by walking through the community and selling from home. Most of them are selling clothes, shoes and jewelry, while others run beauty salons, grocery stores, etc. Margarita makes her home in a simple structure with her husband. They live in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area.

Margarita operates a Fantasia, a small business where she sells miscellaneous products. She has been in business for over six years, starting with some savings she had. While she says that her most important challenge is developing her business, she continues to enjoy it. She is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use her loan to invest in cosmetics, shoes, women accessories, underwear, clothes, etc. to sell. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. Margarita is very happy for your support and she wants to thank you in her group’s name and her own!!!

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes, women accessories, underwear, clothes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Néstor

texts.en: Three years ago, Nestor saved up to open his own shop. He has always enjoyed selling but has found managing his business challenging. He used to do his accounting with pen and paper and found it difficult to control his inventory and know how much he was making. He purchased aTiendatek because he thinks it can help alleviate that part of his work so that he can concentrate on improving his services, getting more customers, and making more sales. He hopes it will also allow him to spend more time with his four children and enjoying his favorite past-times.

loans.use: to pay for a Tiendatek device to better manage his store

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is a musician. He makes a living playing at weddings and restaurants. Recently Stepan began to remodel his apartment. He put in new wallpaper, new windows, water pipes, etc. Stepan is asking for a loan to finish his remodeling project. 
Stepan has one artificial leg. It is a result of high sugar levels in his blood. This does not discourage him at all. Stepan is a very active and positive person who sets goals and makes plans to reach them.

loans.use: to finish remodeling in two rooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a Tiendatek device to better manage his store

loans.name: Roberto Timoteo

texts.es:
ROBERTO TIMOTEO tiene 38 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se ddeican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

ROBERTO TIMOTEO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de patos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, ranger, 1 cerdo. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras.

Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Ventanas cada seis meses dependiendo la siembra.

El sueño es aumentar los sembríos y apoyar a la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte en especial el boli.
texts.en:
Roberto Timoteo is 38, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas in Los Rios province. 

The members of the "27 de mayo" communal bank work in agriculture, and all live near the rural settlement of Cadial. Almost all have been brought up in that area, mostly engaging in farming and livestock-raising.

Roberto Timoteo farms, growing corn and rice. He also raises ducks and pigs. He is applying for the loan so that he can buy urea, insecticides, weedkiller herbicide and a pig. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for planting.

He makes his purchases and carries out his sales in Ventanas every six months, depending on the planting.

His dream is to increase his crops and help his family. In his free time, he likes to play sports; especially volleyball.

loans.use: To buy urea, insecticides, weedkiller, herbicide, and a pig.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: La Sra. Alejandrina tiene 46 años, ella se dedica a la venta  de comida  en su puesto de venta se encuentran la zona de Villa el Carmen de la ciudad de La Paz, su puesto se encuentra en parada de uno de los muchos minibuses que van por la zona por tal motivo tiene clientela fija, ella es cliente antigua de la institución, La Sra. Alejandrina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como papa, verduras y carnes para la elaboración de sus comidas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de estos insumos,  La Sra. Alejandrina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia, ya que esta es la única actividad con la que cuenta.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 46 years old and works selling food in her food stall, which is located in the Villa el Carmen area of La Paz.  Her food stall is located at one of the stops of the many minibuses that go through the area, and for this reason she has an established customer base.

Alejandrina is a long-standing client of the institution. She plans to use this loan to buy ingredients such as potatoes, vegetables and meat for making her products.  She is requesting this loan because she lacks the capital to buy these ingredients.

Alejandrina is confronting challenges in her business such as growing her customer base.  She plans to use the profits to improve her family’s quality of life, as her business is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale ingredients such as potatoes, rice, oil etc.

loans.name: Mirea Milagro

texts.es:
Mirea es una jovend e 23 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ingenio, la cual se caracteriza por desarrollarse la agricultura, especialmente el cultivo de tuna, frejoles, algodon, entre otros. Mirea es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella no tiene verguenza a nada ya que ella nos comenta que cuando uno trabaja de manera honrada, nada ni nadie hara que uno se sienta menos que los demas. Por ello Mirea con mucho esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando la carrera de enfermeria tecnica, ella estudia por las noches pero por las mañanas se dedica a la venta de chicharrones, bebidas gaseosas entre otros, ella ofrece sus productos a los pasajeros de los buses, ya que camino a ingenio hay un paradero y cuando los buses paran para descansar o echar gasolina a los buses ella se sube a cada uno de los buses a ofrecer sus productos; ella cree qyue esta saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene una buena sazon.

Mirea esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podra realizar mejoras en su viviendam, ya que ella podra refaccionar las paredes, ya que su vivienda es de adobe y presenta varias rajaduras, asimismo realziara tarrajeos y pondra piso de cemento; de esta manera podra mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguira luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Terminar su carrera y ser una gran enfermera".
texts.en:
Mirea is a young woman of 23. She lives in the city of Ingenio, which is characterized by its developing agriculture, especially the cultivation of prickly pear, beans, and cotton among others.

Mirea is a young woman eager to succeed. She is not ashamed of anything, she commented, because when one works in an honest way, nothing and no one will make you feel less than others.

With a lot of effort, Mirea is studying to be a nursing technician. She studies at night, and in the mornings she sells pork, soft drinks, and other products.  She offers her products to bus passengers. She uses ingenuity, and when the buses stop to rest or refuel, she boards the buses to offer her products. She believes she is moving forward with this business because she is very friendly to the customers and her produce is ripe.

Mirea is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help the will give her so she can make improvements to her home. She will renovate the walls since her home is adobe and there are several cracks. She will plaster and also cement the floor. This will improve the quality of life for her family and she will continue to fight to realize her biggest dream, "to finish her schooling and be a great nurse."

loans.use: to improve her home.
